dependencies.express: will be how we run our server
dependencies.react/react-dom: front end package for writing html in javascript files using jsx
dependencies.react-router-dom: can add links and show certain react components when the url is a certain value
dependencies.redux: state management for our front end
dependencies.react-redux: with this we can connect our react components to our redux store
dependencies.redux-thunk: we can now use thunks to do async things
dependencies.redux-logger: creates logs to the console with changes to our redux store

devdependencies.webpack: this starts at some starting file, and takes all your include statements and creates one file using a dependency graph
devdependencies.babel-loader: this will make babel work while webpack is bundling files
devdependencies.webpack-cli: this makes it so we can do the command on the command line webpack -w, which will look for file changes and rebundle our code. We will make this happen as part of our start script
devdependencies.babel-core: this gives the core functionality of babel, which is changing modern javascript such as arrow funtions into javascript readable by most browsers
devdependencies.babel-preset-react: this will change jsx inside our react files into regular javascript
devdependencies.babel-present-env: this can specify what version of browsers we want to support, not too sure on this one yet though
devdependencies.morgan: morgan is logging middleware for our backend

scripts.start-dev: webpack -w will make webpack look for changes and rebundle our code, nodemon server will run our index file in our server folder and restart the server if there is a file change
